Reviews.Title: Neat Little Camera!  Does what it needs to do!
Reviews.Author: Vero A.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I don't know why others are giving this camera a low review.  Perhaps they haven't played with it enough.  I have only had this camera for about two weeks.  I gave it to myself for a birthday present cause it was time to get rid of my old Nikon 3.2 mp camera and I am about to spend a semester in France and throughout Europe doing some field work for my Master's thesis.First of all, the sheer size of this camera is amazing (its smaller than my ipod video).  I was originally going to get the s10 but was unable to find it (I guess they're not selling it anymore), but quite honestly 2 mp difference is no big deal.  12mp is more than enough.  I have gotten so many compliments on this camera so far just because of its size and the fact that it has 12mp rather than 10 or even 8.I think the picture quality is outstanding!  I have been playing with it practically everyday taking pictures of anything and everything to get a good test out of it.  So far, all these pictures look very very nice.  One thing I like to do with cameras is play around with its settings.  This camera, although it has a Best Shot Feature (pre-programmed settings for certain situations), I'm the type of person who likes to experiment with those settings anyway.  This camera allows you to do that with the best shot feature and it has a manual feature so that you can adjust everything!  I hate cameras that won't let you mess with its pre-programmed settings cause let's face it they don't always get it right!  Then the best part is, you can save these settings that you've created and the camera will remember them for you.One thing I see in these reviews is that the picture quality is bad.  The s12 (as I'm sure with other casios) has a "quick shutter" setting.  This setting will immediately take the picture before it has a chance to focus (why you would do that I'm not sure).  You can turn this off!  That was one of the first things I changed when I started playing with it.The HD videos this camera takes are very impressive!  I have posted a couple of them on Youtube (look under my name: vsa23).  They look fantastic on our 52" HDTV!  Have not run into any problems like the sound not being in sync with the video.My ONLY complaint about this camera is that when the camera is on "Best Shot Auto Focus" (the lowest, easiest, setting for grandma), the focus makes very loud almost scratching noises because it is constantly focusing.  I took the camera back, exchanged it for a new one, and even tried the store's two displays and they all seem to do that.  Perhaps this is something that will change with the later s12s that come out.  But in all honesty, I don't use that setting anyway (not that I'm a pro or anything), so it doesn't bother me too much.All in all, I am very happy with this little camera!  It does everything I need it to do (which is really to primarily take pictures) and it offers so much more than I need at the same time (make up setting, dynamic photo, smile shutter, face detection, youtube capture, and more!).  If you're looking for a very nice camera with lots of features in a small compact travel-friendly camera then this one is a very good choice.  I will be posting some of my sample photos on Amazon's customer images thing.  Hope you all find this review useful!

Reviews.Title: Hard to recommend this camera...
Reviews.Author: Brian K. Martin "diggio"
Reviews.Content: I usually shoot with a DSLR and wanted to get a new small camera to carry around and replace my 5 year old Pentax Optio S4i. My main criteria for picking the camera were weight, HD video capture, image quality, and ease of use. I've since updated this list to include image stabilization.The casio s12 is one of the smallest cameras you can get. Reviews also said the camera was snappy. Looking at reviewer's test shots showed it had very good image quality, so I picked one up.I wanted to like this camera. I tried to like this camera. But in the end the camera is just too unreliable to be used as a point and shoot. The images typically look very good on the camera's screen, but on a large monitor they were often under saturated, auto white balance was off, and most importantly they were frequently out of focus.  With this camera, you need to pre-focus with a 1/2 shutter press before taking a picture. Far too often, the camera would never focus - even in sunlight.  The only time there was reliable focus was when the subject was relatively close to the camera (a couple yards or less away) and cooperative. When the focus worked correctly, the picture quality was still not perfect (harsh chromatic aberration) but was admittedly much better than average. I cannot figure out why the focus is so hit or miss. Perhaps it is operator error or lack of image stabilization. It may even be that the camera defaults to focus a few feet away when its autofocus algorithm fails. This would be fine for taking a picture of your friends sitting at a table with you, but it does not work if you are zoomed-in on your kids playing in the yard.The HD video quality was fairly good for nearby subjects. It did suffer from lack of any image stabilization technology and it is doubtful anyone would be using this camera for shooting video with a tripod. With a camera this small I really think you need some form of image stabilization.I will return the Casio and try one of the new Canon's or the Lumix FX-35/37/48 (or even the new Pentax w80).  I would only recommend the Casio for someone who primarily shoots nearby, cooperative subjects. Those images seem to come out OK most of the time and even excellent once in a while.  This camera would not be my recommendation if you want to capture your kids candidly. If you like the Casio style or feature set, perhaps the Casio Z400 will be better since it has image stabilization, a longer zoom, and perhaps some updated firmware.Positives:* Easy to use* Great feature set* Small (but not too small) size* Great set of 'best shot' modes, including a unique whiteboard and business card mode which can replace your scanner* Unlimited length HD video capture in AVI format (good for Windows) at 24fps. The lack of 30fps in HD mode wasn't noticeable.* Good build quality with excellent LCD screen* Good low-light focus lamp* Potential to take some very good picturesNegatives:* Very unreliable focus and sometimes unreliable white balance* Terrible printed user manual (but the online manual is very good)* No standard cable connections on camera for USB* No digital video out from the camera* Some of the in-camera features just did not work reliably. Most notable is the feature where you can subtract the background from around your subject and place the subject in another image.* Lens not very wide (~36mm)

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but you'll need to get a bigger capacity SD card
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Young
Reviews.Content: This Casio EX-S12 was chosen over other compact cameras in the US market, due to its tiny size and price. My intention is to find a super compact but decent camera for my wife to travel with, where a full size DSLR is not desirable.The camera started up quickly but does take about 2-3 seconds between shots (not bad considering that I had the automatic flash on and it'll take time to charge up the capacitor).  The buttons and the menu are intuitive and easy to figure out. The camera is packed with features that I'll never use, such as BestShot, Youtube, Dynamic Photo, smile recognition, etc.  On the other hand, I do find the historgram and the tripod mount highly benficial.Battery life seems to be good. Although it didn't make sense to have a compact camera, but the battery charger is as big as the camera itself, with a long power cable to the outlet. It's a generic detachable cable so I'll replace it with a shorter one (or shorten the one provided).  I've not tried if I can charge the battery by using the USB cable only.As for the resulting photos, it does a great job with portraits as I'm impressed with the smooth and natural skin tone that it produces. I had no problem with noise with the normal ISO setting. It produces beautiful, peaceful pastile color for landscape photos as well.  I did not play with any camera setting to adjust the internal processing, but you'll probably need to do so if you want photos with more contrast and more punch.  It's not an issue with me, since I can always post-process the files later via Photoshop.  As with most point-n-shoot, too bad it doesn't create RAW file format.I tend to use the wide side rather than telephoto with my photography style.  Thus, I hardly use the zoom feature.  This camera has the 36mm equivalent, which is about the normal human's view point so images aren't distorted much.  Not an ultra-wide, but not bad.The on camera flash is okay for a tiny camera, and the output is adjustable.  I do rather see a PC port added with the future model, so I can shoot with an off-camera flash.As for the HD video, it works fine.  Originally, I tested it with an old SD card and was suspicious if audio and video were in sync. Later, I put in a better SDHC card and had no issue with the video. The video in HD mode started up quickly, but it's limited to 10 minute clips (due to size limitation of FAT32 file format as with other point-and-shoot?).  You'll have to remember to find a break to stop-and-restart quickly before the 10 minute is up.Be sure to get the biggest and fast SDHC card that you can get.  My old 1GB SD card was filled quickly with about 7 minutes of HD video and few 12MP photos.  Also, due to its tiny dimension, be sure to use the hand strap.

Reviews.Title: NON-TECHIE'S VERDICT: It's sleek, fits easily in your shirt pocket and shoots REALLY great photos!
Reviews.Author: AmazonLoyalist "BenS"
Reviews.Content: OK, here is the non-techie's verdict on this camera... I really like it and rate it a SOLID FOUR STARS !!!I will leave the techie's to discuss all the pros and cons of the specs. In a nutshell, here are my thoughts:1) It's definitely mini and fits easily in a shirt pocket.  So bring one along in your pocket and you'll always  be ready for a Kodak...oops! "Casio Moment"2) I was all set to buy the silver one, but when they  took it out of the box, it looked way tooo shiny!  Like the color of bright, polished tin... so I  asked to see the other colors and bought the gold,  champagne, beer-colored one. It looks fantastic.3) WITHOUT the manual, I played around with the MENU  and the various buttons and got everything working  to my liking within 30 minutes. And I am no  techie!4) OUTPUT: Yes, the photos and videos ROCKED for this  mini-camera. Expensive, separate-lens, high-end  cameras will take BETTER photos, but these are  DEFINITELY VERY GOOD! Colors are vibrant!5) BEST SHOT - Pre-programmed settings for outdoors,  night, and about 20-other almost-any-event. This  is a fun gadget and let's you focus on the  subject/s while this little cam does all the  work.6) PRICE: Definitely OK for all that you get in that  size!7) C'MON !!!.. I said enough... go out and buy one!  YOU will be HAPPY you did. Trust me. It rocks!

Reviews.Title: Best camera in this category.
Reviews.Author: Solarx.110mb
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is the best camera in this category.  Before I buy any camera I review sample photos full size, which for this camera at 12mp is wall size, about 60 inches wide.  I look for noise, detail and color.  I have had this camera for a week and ran it through my tests and it did not disappoint.  Noise in the blue sky is almost non-existent, something you would expect from an SLR.  Detail in pretty good also.  In daylight I just leave it in auto and it shoots awesome pictures.  Indoors you could leave it in auto, but all your shots will be at 400 ISO which is starting to add noise at this level.  I set it at 200 ISO indoors for near perfect noise free pictures.I have tried some of the Best Shot settings and the landscape scenic setting is terrible, don't even bother using it because it messes up the saturation.  The composite setting is cool that it pictures the subject in motion but there is not much use for it.  I am yet to try all of the Best Shot settings, there is a lot of them.Make-up function works perfectly, maybe too good. It has 12 levels of make-up.  Makes my 79 year old mother look like she is 19.  I would rather take pictures of the way things really are, but this is definitely a cool feature.Low light performance seems really good, it is able to focus and take good shots.HD video is really nice, though 24 fps is a bit choppy.  You will need to learn how to take video at 24 fps.  Basically you need to keep still and do not change direction too fast.  The 640x480 is smoother at 30 fps and it looks pretty good also if there is enough light.  One surprise for me is that it is able to zoom during video.  It is not optical zoom during video it is digital zoom but it performs like optical zoom.  There is no deterioration when in full zoom, and the manual states this also.  This is great to be able to zoom in video.  You can consider this optical video zoom since it performs the same as.  The colors of the video are not as good as broadcast HDTV, but it seems almost as sharp in good lighting.There is no photo editing software included with this camera, which is a shock to me since all my last cameras were Fujifilms and they include a great post processing software.  I searched for a replacement software and found Photoscape, it is free and even better than Finepix software.  At full resolution this Casio comes out with 5-6.8 mb picture file size.  Well with the photoscape I can save in 70% jpg compression that brings down the file size to 1.1 mb, saves a lot of memory.  I compared the difference and I cannot see any difference between the 1.1 mb picture and the 6.5 mb picture, and I am viewing them full size.I normally keep this camera at 3:2 and Normal, again I don't see Fine as being any improvement over Normal.  3:2 is wider than normal to look better on tv's but still can be printed on a 4x6.  The 16:9 seems too wide and then when you go to print them, stores like Walgreens may have a problem cropping part of the picture out of it.I have always had Fujifilms, but Casio just seems to come out with things first and I just couldn't wait for Fujifilm to come out with a comparable camera.  I am glad I made the move to Casio and I think I will stick with Casio for all my future cameras.There is no camera this small with all these features and that takes such awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Pictures & Video, BUT...
Reviews.Author: R. M. Mayhew
Reviews.Content: I had a prior version of this camera that had a docking station to charge the battery and transfer pictures to storage.  It was simple.  You put the camera in the dock and that was it.This version does not have the docking station.  It requires you to remove the battery to charge it.  If you remove the battery for a period of time you will lose your settings.  If you have a charged backup battery and you switch it quickly, I've found the settings (date, time, quality, etc) are retained.The picture quality (still and video) is improved from the EX-S500 I had before.  The screen is much, much easier to read in sunlight.  On the EX-S500 I sometimes had to hold my hand over the screen to block the light so I could see it.What would make this camera an absolute standout is if the charger was a docking station AND could be used to charge the battery separately.  Why not make it as easy as possible to charge and transfer photo's?

Reviews.Title: Casio EX-S12 The Best
Reviews.Author: L. Carrington "Curious One"
Reviews.Content: I have to comment on an excellent camera.  The Casio EX-S12 offers exceptional value in a small package.Pros, to mention a few- Costs about $200 from Amazon.- Creates totally new pictures or video through object isolation or scene separation (powerful).- Allows customizable control panel of the monitor screen.- Supports personalized options through best shot.- Uses the very friendly best shot selection.- Allows personalizing Power On Default Settings.- Creates decent pictures up to 1600 ISO where I prefer 400 ISO or lower.- Allows HD video in 24 frames per second (pan or move the camera slowly).- Allows SD video in 30 frames per second.- Uses standard or legacy parts, such as, SD or SDHC memory cards, backward compatible batteries etc.- Fits easily in a pocket.- Blazes a new trail because this camera is hard to beat.Cons- Charger requires cord and charging unit rather than flip out plug (not a major problem).

Reviews.Title: I wish it was better
Reviews.Author: Andy Sernovitz "Author, Word of Mouth Marketi...
Reviews.Content: I have owned 4 previous versions of this camera. They are fantastic. I use them for work and for family.This one just doesn't work.  Picture quality is worse. When you make movies, the video is out of sync with the audio.I think they tried to put too much in one little camera.  I'm returning this and buying one of the older models.

Reviews.Title: A Great Travel Partner
Reviews.Author: Harvey S. Trop
Reviews.Content: This is a great little digital camera; just perfect for taking snap shots while traveling. It easily fits into a shirt or cargo pants pocket and is so lightweight, you will hardy notice it is there. The LCD screen is crisp and almost the sie of the camera itself. I have found it to be very easy to operate and it has proven to be good for general scenery shots, as well as close-ups of flowers and other objects. The zoom is good and it has an auto anti-shake mode. It has a very nice "best shot" feature, that allows one to optimize the photo based on the type of shot. It has a good flash and you can select whether or not to use the flash (useful in a museum). It doesn't compete with my digital SLR for its zoom capabilites, but I bought it to use on business trips and as a back-up camera. On a recent hiking trip, I found myself using it more than my SLR for standard shots, because it was so easy to use and the image quality was very good. For the business traveler, this is great alternative to lugging around a digital SLR, along with your luggage and briefcase.

Reviews.Title: Video Recording limited compared to S10 (previous model)
Reviews.Author: David Bradbury
Reviews.Content: Despite the plus of offering an HD option in the S12, Casio has reverted to the old AVI JPEG format rather than sticking with MPEG4 H.264 which was used in last year's model, the S10. Also, while the S10 could record video as long as the battery/memory would hold, the S12 is limited to 10 minutes. Very disappointing to see Casio switch away from the one of the key aspects of their Exilim Card line that they actually got right. I will continue to enjoy the S10 which I purchased last year.

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim EX-S12 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kim Simons Kraan "K. Kraan"
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade for me to a similar casio Exilim I purchased 3 yrs ago.Unfortunately,  the old camera hit the floor, and consequently the little tab that holds the battery in place had snapped off. Quots to repair were upwards of $60....so, after spending the last year frustrated with re-setting the tab in place each time I pulled the SD card out, I finally decided to buy a newer version. This version takes great/awesome pics, and has many new features the previous version did not. Very cool, lightweight, easy to travel, skate, and ski with.

Reviews.Title: Beat the Canon Powershots for details but not for facial color/tones. Have a flaw on Auto-flash - shot when you blink
Reviews.Author: B. Li "DontUnderstand"
Reviews.Content: I agree that this s12 image quality beat Canon Powershots (1000, 780IS that I tested) on sceneries (if you zoom-in to see the details) but NOT on human faces, in term of realistic, color/tone.There is also a big problem I found for the Auto-flash. It snaps right when your eyes half-way blink due to the flash - everytime. I did self-portrait to find this out, and it should apply to shooting others as well. It is a design flaw I believe. You have to remember to choose Red-eye reduction, which does not make me blink in the picture, before shooting persons.Also I cannot believe how poor the quality of the image when I shoot the 1st picture out of the box. If I did not try harder, I would have returned it the same day. I don't understand why Casio wants to set the default to its worst.I am still wondering if I should return this for Canon SD780, which performs (responds) better and felt more solid in my hand. But Canon, even after so many generations of Powershot, does not improve any for the sharpness of its images - same quality as my old SD-400, if not worse, which with only 4m pixels.

Reviews.Title: Warranty Worthless
Reviews.Author: Craig C. Douglas
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these in early September, 2010. In January, 2011 the lens stopped retracting, so the camera stopped operating. Casio refused to fix the problem unless I paid them nearly $100 even though there is a 1 year warranty. They were willing to let me upgrade the camera (including to the same model) for $80-120. This is the second Casio Exilim camera to have this problem in 3 months for me. I like the Casio cameras, but if they do not adhere to their warranty, send them a message and buy a camera from another vendor.

Reviews.Title: A little too slim
Reviews.Author: A. Soto "debeckster"
Reviews.Content: It's rare that you would be unhappy with something so small.  In fact, this camera is super slim.  I carried it in a soft case in my pocket and would find it ON when I went to use it with almost all the battery life drained.  Figured out that there is an "any button on" setting where although turned off, if you press any button, the camera turns on.  This setting is defaulted to on.  Furthermore, camera did not have a sleep function or auto-off, so it would be on for hours in my pocket.HD video is choppy at best.  If the camera is perfectly still on a tripod or table, video is okay, but holding the camera made the video very grainy.For the price, I can't complain.  Would give an overall 3/5 based on how I think it would function if carried in a hard case and used with a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing Videos
Reviews.Author: Spencer
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2XLGPL94JBJG1', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2XLGPL94JBJG1loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2XLGPL94JBJG1currentClick) { return cv_mo2XLGPL94JBJG1currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:27 MinsI bought it as a backup photo/video camera for my T1i so I can bring it with me all the time.But the video quality is kind Disappointing.1. Seems no auto focus while recording. And the videos I recorded are mostly out of focus.2. Bright vertical lines ruined the videos.3. Encoded with MJPEG - I figured out to recode one hour HD video, it will take around 10GB space, way to big.4. only 24 fps, makes fast moving objects blur and not usable.It is small, good looking, and has many options to tune up photo quality. but I am not sure if I should keep it given above video issues.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is great the only problems I had was with the noisy zoom and the busy please wait message you get sometimes after taking several pictures, other then that the camera is great, the pictures are great and its very easy to use. After messing with the options a little bit I realized that if you switch the mode to best shot mode it tends to stop doing the busy please wait message , it only seems to happen with other options. When I first took it out of the box the first thing I noticed was the buzzing noise it makes when the zoom is trying to focus... its an odd noise almost as if a little bug is trapped inside it and trying to get out. I had recently tried the Canon PowerShot SD780IS but had to return it because of the ridiculously blurry pictures. This Casio on the other hand takes amazing photos even in low lights... with the canon i remember trying very hard to keep still just to get a sharp picture, it was nearly impossible. All around this Casio is great camera aside from those minor problems I guess no camera is perfect :)

Reviews.Title: Sophistication with Simplicity in a Minature Design
Reviews.Author: Rocco J. Verducci
Reviews.Content: The Casio Exilim EX-S12 was a gift purchased for my brother-in-law. It met all the criteria for use for him. His desire was to take high quality pictures and videos with little effort in changing settings on the camera. The Casio's automatic mode fit the bill for him. This combined with the smallest footprint imaginable made this an ideal camera to take with him on his honeymoon to Hawaii. The pictures and video were incredible.If you want the best pictures without the tedium of reading the entire manual and having to alter a multiple of settings, I would highly advise taking a look at this excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Alright
Reviews.Author: D. E. Hoffman "dustboy"
Reviews.Content: It's been a few weeks since the purchase.  Camera is real easy to use.  I love the size of it.  Only beef I have with this camera is the picture noise.  Perhaps it's my lack of knowledge on the settings but my previous casio camera had no such noise.  I still like it and am overall happy.  Right now the battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and portable
Reviews.Author: Mimi Hapten
Reviews.Content: For your one and only high quality camera - no. Of course not. But for catching that moment when no one else has anything but a cellphone handy, it is excellent!Carry a mini Gorilla pod so you can bring down the ISO and with that the noise in night time photos, or moments in your favorite restaurant. On clear and sunny days it is excellent too. Have not had the problem described with blurry pics out of focus, just be steady and press down half way first before shooting and you'll be fine.You can do some stuff with the settings too, once you figure them out - had to go online because the manual did not cover very much. You can customize a panel to the right of the screen and always have your favorite settings at hand.I really like the looks of it too, has a nice build and design.Overall very happy with mine!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Roberta B. Macdonald
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd or 4th Casio camera.  I like its portability, size, big screen, and other features.  I am a travel agent checking out destinations, ships, and hotels, in addition those great videos of my 1st great grandchild over the holidays!!.This camera's ability to use an 8GB SD card doesn't run out of memory w/videos and pictures as others did - one of the reasons I picked it.  In addition you can take a snapshot while making a video!!  Pixels are 12MP which give me clear pictures.  I have not yet tried the addition feature of putting an animation into a still picture but think that will be fun.Recovery speed is definitely goodI learn "how to" with each new feature.  Definitely a great camera -

Reviews.Title: The Little Camera that Packs a Big Punch
Reviews.Author: K. Vetrano
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the Casio EX-S12. The small size is amazing. It's no bigger then a credit card and about a half inch thick in width. It easily fits into your pants pocket, purse and tote bag with no problem. It's a great camera to keep on hand at all times because you just never know when you want to capture a special moment.The camera features A LOT of features and modes. So many that I don't even know if I will ever use them all.I like that the battery is rechargable but I would have liked to have a regular battery option too for when the battery charge runs out and you still have more pictures to take.The quality of the images are amazing. It did a great job in low light with some "action" shots I took at a wedding recently.This is a great camera in my opinion. It might now have all the "bells and whistles" like some other cameras but for regular every day use this camera is ideal.

Reviews.Title: EXILIM S12
Reviews.Author: R. RAMSEY "HelpthePeople"
Reviews.Content: What a great camera, and pocket sized too. Very sharp pictures and video. Very easy to use, especially when shooting pics and you want to shoot a video. Just push a button and it starts the video mode.

Reviews.Title: Slow at start up!
Reviews.Author: Snow Owl
Reviews.Content: I had the S10 that I was very happy with but gave to a friend. I was looking for another S10 but the S12 was the same price.  It is a nice camera BUT slow to start up, about 3-4 seconds.  Also after taking photo another 3-4 secs......busy please wait!!!  I hate the fact that Casio have added a proprietary USB socket (as with the S10)  why they done this is beyond me!  The best thing about it is the size and ease of use.  The paint came off the S10 easily so I went with the silver on the S12.  I am thinking of sending it back to Casio for a replacement!

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim EX-S12
Reviews.Author: R. Fajarit "ronf"
Reviews.Content: The Casio Exilim has been meeting and exceeding my expectations.  It handles low lighting very well for video recording. The pictures are very good.  It is portable and fast start up speed.  Pictures however when taken may take some time to process if you have set to the highest settings. This camera replaced my EX-S600 which I enjoy using also.

Reviews.Title: Everything in a point and shoot plus more
Reviews.Author: Roger Bergman
Reviews.Content: 12 MP, zoom, wore it in a phone case on my belt when going out, takes good pics with and without flash. I have this and a DSLR

Reviews.Title: great camera, terrible manual
Reviews.Author: D. Marcus
Reviews.Content: I've had many digital cameras in the last few years.  My daughter has a casio 6mp camera that has taken excellent picture, and I've always liked the size of the casio cameras, so I bought the S12.  First of all the camera is very easy to use and so far seems to take excellent pictures.  BUT, I'm the kind of guy who actually reads the manual and likes to know what all the features do.  So today I cracked open the manual to see what all these wonderful features actually do..... no mention of any of the features in the manual.  The manual mentions the setting but doesn't say what it does!  Amazing.Oh well..

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: little grandma "young at heart grandma"
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera.  It fits in my pocket or purse and is handily available any time I need it.  Takes great photos too.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality needs improvement
Reviews.Author: Paul Lee
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and fits into easily into my front pockets, however the picture quality needs major improvement.PROS:- Size (small and compact)- Decent VideosCONS:- picture Quality (even with Best Shot/Manual/Fine settings)- Weak zoom- Build quality (Weak and plastic feel to the camera)

Reviews.Title: great slim camera
Reviews.Author: h snyder
Reviews.Content: nice slim camera.  battery lasts forever.  takes great pictures, love the focus and makeup feature.  it is hard to take close ups though.

Reviews.Title: Bang for buck!
Reviews.Author: Buck Marley
Reviews.Content: Despite what other reviews say this is a pretty good camera. I had the EX-700 for 3 years before giving it to my son and buying a new one... and here's where I made a mistake: instead of sticking to Exilim I got a Panasonic Lumix DC50. It resulted way more expensive than this one and doesn't have many features, like video editing, direct video button, zoom during video recording... it's slow, big, shows lines and bubbles in the pics, and the sound recorded is crappy.I got this Exilim S12 and that's it! Small, quick, easy set up, and does the job nicely. It's my favorite, period. If you had an Exilim before you understand.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Shaw Lynn Preeste
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  It's a reconditioned unit, so I didn't really know what to expect.  All I knew was I wanted my wife to have her Casio Exilim back in her hands and be happy.  She had a different model, but it looked and acted the same.  Well, acted ALMOST the same.  And, ever since her camera failed (lens would no longer extend), she's been unhappy and cannot take pictures.  I bought her a new camera, even smaller than the Exilim, but it had a touch screen and just didn't work like her beloved Casio.  So, I took the plunge and bought this reconditioned Casio Exilim EX-S12.It is amazing.  I couldn't be happier.  Like I said, I didn't know what to expect when buying reconditioned, but when it arrived, it was llike brand new.  The only thing missing was the box it originally came in.  But the box being used to ship it was better than the original, anyway.  The camera has all the features of her old one, and for her use, it has exactly the same functions.  (Actually, it has more functions, but why confuse the issue.)  She's happy as a clam, and when she's happy, I'm happy.  And, it's a great camera, and a Casio, and an Exilim, takes great pictures, and is tiny.  Just what the doctor ordered.

Reviews.Title: Buena camara
Reviews.Author: Daily Mota
Reviews.Content: Simplemente excelente producto y funcional. Muy bueno sinceramente, cumplió todas mis expectativas y funciona perfectamente. Totalmente recomendable para todas las personas. Muchas gracias

Reviews.Title: Camera is Exactly What We Wanted!!
Reviews.Author: Laurie Allen
Reviews.Content: The product arrived sooner than expected, was truly new and is exactly what we wanted.  Price was right and wish we could have ordered more.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Sudds
Reviews.Content: Great bang for the buck!Still going strong after a couple years use.  Takes GREAT pics and easy to operate.  My granddaughters can use it well.

Reviews.Title: bonita
Reviews.Author: nestor pereira
Reviews.Content: rapido y seguro el servicio me gusto el producto porque era justo lo que vi es justo lo que me llego

Reviews.Title: warranty unreliable
Reviews.Author: boudu
Reviews.Content: LCD failed (half of it turned white) after 6 months.  casio says send it to time machine. latter calls to say that "unfortunately the LCD is not covered by warranty". below is the warranty that comes with the camera:" this product, except consumables or articles with limited resistance (e.g. battery case), is warranted...one year...there will be no parts or labor charge "my own conclusion is that you would be well advised to avoid buying casio products.

Reviews.Title: great thing camera
Reviews.Author: jgp123456
Reviews.Content: i did a lot of research looking for the thinnest camera i could buy (not insanely priced) and decided upon this camera.  everything has been great with the camera and it takes great pictures.  i'm dinging it one star b/c my wife dropped it getting out of the suv and cracked the top left part of the screen to smithereens.  i've dropped my cannon MANY times and nothing close to the damage.  it's a great camera just not the best durability.

Reviews.Title: No More Casio For Moi
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This is my second Casio Camera, I loved the first!  Alas, it was dropped and could not be repaired.  I was offered the opportunity to replace it with a refurbished Casio Exilim EX-S12 for $100.00.  I decided to take a chance on it.I received the new camera and it was defective.  It would continually give me an error "Busy, Please Wait" after shooting a photo, instead of flashing the photo on the screen for review.  If I reset the camera to the stock settings, the error would stop, but as soon as any changes were made to the settings, the error would re-occur.I took it to Time Machine, the local repair center for Casio.  Actually I took it there twice, it was never repaired.  I contacted Casio direct and was told I had to send it to New Jersey.  I was also told to include a description of the problem, which I did, at length.  Anyone who took a minute to read the correspondence would understand that resetting the camera would alleviate the error, and making changes to the settings would make the error occur.Guess what.  They reset the camera and sent it back to me!  Hellooooooooooooo!  Did anyone read the required description of the problem?  I guess not.  Calls to Casio to speak to a supervisor went unreturned.For the $100.00 I have spent way too much time trying to get what I paid for.  Maybe that is Casio's strategy, wear the purchaser down.I do not know if customer service is better at other manufacturers, but I will not be spending any more money with Casio.  It really is a shame.  It is a great camera minus the error.  It is super slim and perfect on many levels.  It takes excellent photos, as did the previous model I owned.  I am an endurance cyclist and I stuff this neat little thing in my jersey when the opportunities arise.  It really does take better photos than any of the mini cameras my friends own.This is the first review I have written on Amazon, I wish it had been a positive one instead.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: kay "artist"
Reviews.Content: This a great point and shoot, but I was very disappointed in photo quality in low light, and ESP. When I cropped in iPhoto, I lost clarity.  The light metering was very poor, for what needed in getting really good photos of jewelry. I am selling it and have bought the cannon ps. g12,which I LOVE!!!

Reviews.Title: Wife loves the make-up mode
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This is a very small, easy to use camera. Pictures are very crisp and clear even when resolution is reduced. My wife loves the make up mode. Haven't had it long enough to judge durability. I would recommending the purchase of an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: it's a good one
Reviews.Author: Ninny J
Reviews.Content: my only concern is the flash, it worked at first but will be sending back to have flash checked but still love the camera

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Casio Exilim and my favorite so far is the S10 which was stolen.  The S12 is not a bad camera and so easy to take everywhere with you as it very compact.  Great pictures.  My daughter's which she has owned for a year started to take blurry photos and videos - just sent it off to Casio for repairs so we will see what happens.  I still like their cameras though.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Duncan
Reviews.Content: I have been using exilim cameras for years now. Every year they get better. Loved this camera...until I dropped it and it shattered into a billion pieces. I retally suggest this camera

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever
Reviews.Author: Gamer
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple, amazing camera. Its very slim, very easy and sexy camera. i love this camera and has great quality. especialy for family photos or video taping. This camera is youtube capable so if your a vlogger or something than this is perfect for you. i also use this for face book or send some videos to family members. i have had this for years and i am in love. much better than some fat camera with crappy quality. this camera is just pure amazing and i love this camera. this is a defiant buy

Reviews.Title: camera ready!!
Reviews.Author: Terrence D. Brown "guitar player wannabe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Xmas, & she loves the ease of use, & the many features on the camera. The small size but a large viewing screen is an added plus.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: cath
Reviews.Content: We love this camera, it takes clear quality photos, it also hasreally great features that we love to play with. It was a great buy

Reviews.Title: Great point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: K. Roan "K. Roan"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much I bought a second one! About two years ago I bought a previous version of this camera, and when I sadly left it in a bar a few months back, I purchased this updated version. The size of this camera can't be beat. It is incredibly thin, about the size of a credit card. The picture quality is great, and it has a zoom that is good enough for most occasions. My favorite feature, though, is all of the different shooting modes. There are so many options in the "Best Shot" menu (soft light, night scene, self portrait, etc etc etc) that there is a perfect option for every shot. I have gotten so many compliments on photos I have taken because I take advantage of all those Best Shot modes. Definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: UCFfan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend's birthday. She loves the portability and ease of use. It has a 'best shot' feature that will automatically adjust to the best setting, this has to be her favorite feature. It has facial recognition and a timer. This is a great camera for the money and portability.

Reviews.Title: OK camera, usability issues
Reviews.Author: Andrey G. revyakin
Reviews.Content: I did not expect much from the camera given its size and cost. I got it to quickly take pictures of DIY projects in progress. For a pocket camera, it does the job well. Autofocus tends to be unreliable; for some reason, objects at infinity (e.g. the skyline) are problematic.  Exposure auto-settings (ISO, white balance, EV) produce over-saturated pictures by choosing higher ISOs, also giving pixel noise. With some tweaking of the settings (lowest ISO and stepped down exposures) and saving them into memory I was able to make the camera produce OK pictures.The LCD screen shows vertical pixel cross-talk which gives a false impression that the image quality is quite bad, but after a picture is taken the cross-talk is gone. Perhaps there is an algorithm eliminating the artifact by post-processing - this might explain why it takes 2-3 sec for the camera to save a picture.The body of the camera is aluminum and is quite sturdy - good for a pocket camera. However, the battery compartment lid is made of thin, cheap plastic, and is very easy to open accidentally. After only 2 months of use (during which I took the battery out at most 5 times) the plastic lid fell off and broke into pieces. This has essentially rendered the camera non-usable since the battery started falling off or losing contact 50% of time. To keep the camera working I had to machine a new lid out of aluminum; I then had to drill and tap holes in plastic inside of the camera to hold the new aluminum lid in place. Here the overall sturdiness of the body has helped since the camera had to be clamped in a vice. :)Pros: Cost, size, picture quality given cost+size, good video quality.Cons: poor design of battery compartment lid; unreliable autofocus; unreliable auto exposure settings.

Reviews.Title: Owned 2--both broken after couple months
Reviews.Author: Medusa "booklover"
Reviews.Content: I've owned two generations of this camera and both lasted only a short while. The 1st began to malfunction after about 2 months. Instead of allowing me to turn it on and take photos, it would go directly to date time settings, and I would have to reset the date time every time I turned it on. Date/time settings can be bypassed, but if they are, the camera would not know what order the photos were taken and they would download all jumbled up, which is actually a bigger pain than you'd imagine when going to order prints or locate a specific photo. I also had problems with the battery/charger from the very start. Sometimes it would charge, sometimes not.I misplaced my first and a friend learned that my original camera was lost bought me a newer version as a gift. About a week from the time I began using it, it also began to malfunction. It won't turn on much of the time, and I've already replaced the battery and charger. No luck.This camera seems to work well at first, but has no longevity. If you want a camera that will last more than a few weeks/months, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Adrian D.
Reviews.Content: Simply satisfies my basic needs. It takes good pictures for portrait and landscapes, it has set good pre-defined set escenes for this (BEST-SHOT). Slim design, good to handle it. Great the direct button for taking video. Should be improved the night shots.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: I have many camera's and started in 35 mm many years ago. This digital camera has everything you need and even comes in a size so small you forget you are carring it. The pictures are great in 12meg and I have blown up pictures to 8x10 with no problems. My grand children love it when I take their picture and on my computer make it so large only their teeth or eyes are on the screen in perfect focus. An excellent deal from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Sal
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera choice, very sharp picture, slim design (half the profile of my previous Exilm), very easy to take pictures and video clips.

Reviews.Title: Great secondary/casual camera
Reviews.Author: Christine Tahai
Reviews.Content: Awesome tiny camera to throw in your pocket to go to the bar/see a band/ go to a party/somewhere there is a good level of ambient noise.If you want to take snapshots at a wedding (or other QUIET venue) this camera is NOT the one.  It is loud enough the bride just might interrupt the ceremony to come smack you and take away your camera!If you are like me, and have the nice expensive camera to bring to weddings, and just want something tiny to throw in your pocket for partying that will take great pics and is cheap enough (I bought the green - which I lOVE for only 115!) that if you lose it/smash it/whatever it didn't cost so much you want to snap, this is PERFECT for that!LOVE all the "Best Shot" settings to choose from.  Really idiots-proofs snapshot taking.This thing is so tiny, I've had 2 people so far (and I've had the camera for 48 hrs..) go (I paraphrase) "Oh, is that a new cell phone? Its so small! ...What?!  That's a camera??....  12mp???!!!!"They BOTH thought it was a tiny cell phone!  lol!!  BUY IT!!!  But don't use it at quiet/solemn venues.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera!
Reviews.Author: Tkboll89
Reviews.Content: Great camera! It's very thin and light but takes awsome pictures at 12.1 mp. Would recommend to anyone who wants a great compact camera with alot of settings.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Poe
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a user-friendly camera that takes quality pictures.  Found it in this one.

Reviews.Title: Casio S-12 Video Quality
Reviews.Author: bill briggs
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for almost everything except video.  There is a problem with vertical lines produced by brighter areas of the image, especially in HD.  This is most notably evident in a situation where a spot of sunlight is reflected from an object into the image, but it occurs in many other images.  This will cause a bright vertical line to streak that entire frame at the point of brightness.  I returned the original camera twice for a replacement, and all three of the cameras I tried have the same problem, which Casio seems unwilling to own up to.  I have used the Exilim for many years and am now on my third model of this usually excellent product.  The older models I have used do NOT have this problem with the video, so it is not endemic to video imaging.  I do not know if it is a problem with software or what, but I am frustrated with Casio Service not correcting this problem.

Reviews.Title: Save your money!
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Hey all. I had originally bought this camera back in 2007 when it had first been released. Recently I traveled to Las Vegas and lost my beautiful Casio camera. So because I loved it so much, I bought this camera, still believing it was the same camera... But it's not! The camera is so slow and takes forever to do anything! Sure it is sleek and cool, but for the price you pay, you'd be better off getting a different camera for a much better value. DON'T BUY ME!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Thius is a greta camera if you are not looking to become an expert photographer. It takes great pictures, very easy to use. The features are easy to figure out too.

Reviews.Title: Good Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: yojimmy
Reviews.Content: Great feature set for the price including HD video.  Highly portable & excellent build quality.  Controls & buttons are quite small making it a challenge for people with big fingers like me.

Reviews.Title: Great compact digital camera
Reviews.Author: W. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Selected this camera for ease of use, fast shutter response, and picture quality and it seems to be doing great.

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim S-12 camera
Reviews.Author: WYODana
Reviews.Content: Just about the smallest camera around, and it takes GREAT photos. Battery life is fantastic. Best-shot feature is nice. Everyone is jealous of my TINY awesome camera.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Ordered, Just What I Expected,
Reviews.Author: P.A.E. "Wishful Thinker"
Reviews.Content: This is our third Exilim camera and. like the other two it's the perfect camera for what we want.  It's easy to use, has all the features we need, has good picture quality, and it is relatively lightweight but sturdy.We can comfortably carry the camera anywhere, and it's rugged enough to take some bouncing around. Uploading photos to our hard drive is simple.The order shipped the day after we placed the order, and it arrived two days later, well packaged and in perfect condition.Some friends who are more serious about photography than are we have tried our Exilims, and while they offer quibbles about features they would need that ours do not have, they acknowledge that the camera is just about right for our purposes, and they marvel at the price.We're very satisfied

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera and very portable!
Reviews.Author: J. Cifelli "J"
Reviews.Content: Love the size of this camera!  Bought it in green for my husband.  Nice to have something besides black.  Takes great pics and video.  No complaints and agree with all the great reviews this camera has received!  My mother had a dif. model number of the Exilim and she highly recommended it when I was looking to purchase a camera for hubby's gift. Guess we are a Casio camera family now!  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: love the how compact the camera is. fits nicely in my pocket to where i barely notice it. camera has a very sleek gloss black finish. only disadvantage is that one has to eject the battery and place inside the charger which im not every use to yet. pictures and videos come out super crisp and clear. love casio and love this exilim camera

Reviews.Title: Great everyday camera/camcorder
Reviews.Author: nowann
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera up recently because I was looking for an everyday camera that could do pictures and videos at a reasonable pricepoint. This was the perfect fit for me. The controls and menu are all simple and intuitive to use, no problems at all.The one thing I would recommend for people considering purchasing this is you will definitely want to pick up an extra SD card for this. There is internal memory, but even on the lowest quality settings, internal memory only allows you one minute of video or about 80 pictures out of the box.Playing with the camcorder, it actually was able to pick up the sound of my dog licking its lips from at least two feet away!My favorite feature of this camera is that is counts down on the display how many pictures and/or time for videos you have left available for on your memory card/internal memory (it might be a common feature these days - I'm not sure, but I didn't have it on my previous camera). This way, you know when to start cutting videos short and can swap out cards to not miss an important scene, etc.I'm happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: George F. Heim
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a month-no problems.  Like the buttons that let you access the photo/video modes which make it easy to switch-also the review picture button is right there without having to go into the menu as in other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good Things Come in Small Packages!
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle S. Brodie
Reviews.Content: This is a really great little camera! It takes wonderful piccies, is easy to use, and fits into a very small space! I love it! Thanks Casio for making such a fantastic product!

Reviews.Title: A great little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory Watkins "I hear"
Reviews.Content: I gave my wife the camera as a gift to replace her old one. I could not believe all of the features the camera detailed. My wife is very satisfied with the camera and found it simple to operate. I would not be hesitant  to recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: nice sharp pics
Reviews.Author: Dan (aka THXkid)
Reviews.Content: takes great nice sharp pics and as happy with HD video you have to hold camera very still and pan very very slow or the picture will jitter, but used a program to make it a HD wmv AND IT PLAYS GREAT 720P on a sony PS3.

Reviews.Title: Awful Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Italiano
Reviews.Content: I've never had to give a bad review.. and I really wanted to like this camera.  I perused the casio website for quite a long time, looking at their photo examples.  I expected this camera to take decent photos out of the box, it did not. After making adjustments, the photos are NOT good.  Color is washed out, the images are blurry and pixelated on the ends.  My old Canon G2 at 4 mp still takes vastly superior photos.  This is going back today.NOTE:  The only reason I am giving it 2 stars is because it is a very well crafted camera, very solid and the size is incredible.  But if it can't take decent photo's, those don't matter much to me.

Reviews.Title: Camera Breaks and Casio has Irritating Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Douglas J. Mayson
Reviews.Content: My camera has broken twice.  I bought it at Radioshack and unfortunately lost the receipt.  I went into the store to return the camera and after like 30 days you have to send it back to Casio (which of course is a pain).  So I needed to get a reprint of the receipt, fill out some paperwork online, and pay for postage to have the camera returned.  They did a good job with turning it around and getting it back to me with without charge.  Now, two weeks later it has broken again.  I've bought canon products in the past and have never had this problem.  Guess you pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Not bad but disappointing
Reviews.Author: A. Culp
Reviews.Content: This camera was better then the canon and sony camera I tried but it was still kinda disappointing.  when you turned the camera off it would forget all the settings you had changed which gets annoying and time consuming to constantly fix.  It took a little long to get back to photo mode after taking the picture.  But I'd have to say the biggest problem I had with this camera is that it would crop images automatically at the top so even if you had a subject in frame you'd lose the top bit of the image almost always messing up your shot. I was expecting better considering how good my old casio exilim was.  Camera being returned.

Reviews.Title: Little, awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Sidecar
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome.The smallest camera around.Stilish, everybody is gelous of my tuny S12.Takes GREAT pics, also in dim light.And HD video, too.Battery life is fantastic.In a nutshell: the best compact around, IMO. And you can take it with you in your pocket, always.Definitely a 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim EX-S12 12MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: A. Silva "ElevenGate"
Reviews.Content: Good camera, just too much plastic unlike the previous model.Oh, It's a bit too slow, too many unnecessary features.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good...
Reviews.Author: Christine Jimenez "Tigerlili"
Reviews.Content: JUST DONT DROP IT!  Mine cracked in half, otherwise, it's pretty good! Pictures turn out better with Nikons obviously though...

Reviews.Title: GREAT FEATURES - DISAPPOINTING PICTURE QUALITY
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Tremmel
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this camera (especially after readng all the great reviews). I own a Minolta Dimage, which is about 4 years old and wanted to replace it with a smaller, sleeker camera. The Casio is just that-great size, wonderful features (which were easy to locate and understand), and a sleek body. But the picture quality was terrible. The pictures were always washed out-no matter how I tried to adjust the camera. When putting the pictures taken with the Casio next to pictures taken with my Minolta the difference was amazing-the Minolta bested the Casio every time (and the Minolta is not an expensive camera and is 4 years old!). My husband suggested that perhaps the Casio had a defect and that I should return it and order another one.  I returned the camera  but I ordered a Pentax 80 (which hasn't arrived yet).  Oh, one more thing the shutter lag is WAAAY TOO LOONG!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lenny N.
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing, elegant, thin camera. I was looking to buy a new digital camera and my main criteria was width. My previous camera was also part of the Casio Exilim family, an older one, but still small in width compared to other digital cameras. My friends always admired how skinny that previous one was and this camera is even skinnier! It looks great and fits amazing features into a sleek package. There are a few nit picky bits about this camera that i thought i should just mention. Thought it has a large rich screen, part of it is used for a 'sidebar' and though it's convenient to have compared to little icons scattered around, the sidebar somewhat shrinks the image. Upon reviewing the picture, however, it looks fine. I do now know if the picture is being stretched out to fit the screen or if it's shrunk to incorporate the sidebar. Image quality is superb so the shrinking/stretching doesn't matter. This camera is filled with extra features, but the manual doesn't really explain them. This shouldn't really matter to normal users as the camera is ready to shoot as soon as you put the battery in, but i'm a techie so i HAVE to go through all the menus and play with all the adjustments the camera had to offer. It just would be nice if the manual explained them. Other than that, i love this camera. It is so skinny and makes all my friends and family jealous, and all for a good price too.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Vicki Hopper
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best!!!  Very easy to use and it's small which I like.

Reviews.Title: casio EX-S12
Reviews.Author: Kristine E. Wright "Kris"
Reviews.Content: Loved the camera, very slim, beautiful video and wonderful pictures.  Received the wrong color.  I ordered pink and received champagne.  But I love the color they sent me.  Within a week the shutter would only close halfway.  I have not contacted Casio to see how they will deal with that.  Hopefully they will fix or replace it.Everyone who sees it is amazed at the size and quality of the pictures.  Fits right in your pocket or pocketbook.  I keep it with me all the time.  I'm upset about the shutter not working but hopefully they will make good on the product.  If not for this, I would have rated it a five-star.

Reviews.Title: Truly Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Bundy
Reviews.Content: First off, my previous camera was a Casio Exilim EX-Z1000 and it was excellent, I never had a single problem. This camera is the complete opposite. I bought my first, which came defective and would never focus. I returned it and got a replacement, which had the same problem. It made a loud clicking noise, clearly something wrong, but would rarely focus correctly. I even took it to a professional camera store, and they without hesitation said it was defective. Of the few pictures it actually focused on, the quality was less than perfect. My EX-Z1000 (over two years old) continued to take better pictures. Casio's once quality line-up of cameras is no more. Don't waste your money.Sony's DSC-W290, which is nearly identical in specs to this, and has the same price is the better choice.

Reviews.Title: wrong language
Reviews.Author: Guy Eddy "upperlakeguy"
Reviews.Content: when entering the language phase of the camera it accidently went to japanese and i can not correct this -----any suggestions this is a casio exs12mp camera

Reviews.Title: I love the Casio Exilim EX-S12
Reviews.Author: M. Adan
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! Very compact and portable and takes GREAT picsLove it

Reviews.Title: CASIO exilim
Reviews.Author: Luca Alina Maria
Reviews.Content: Be aware that it has a problem with a certain format (4/3), it takes the pictures with an extra zoom than you wanted. I would say it's clearly a bug.

Reviews.Title: rarely used then it broke
Reviews.Author: K L Will
Reviews.Content: bought this for my daughter to take to college.  she only used it a few times then took on a trip to England. 2nd day of trip the lens stuck out and wouldn't retract.  will never buy a casio camera again.

Reviews.Title: PERSONALLY, I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS
Reviews.Author: J. Lin "have yet to find a worthwhile P&S;"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a good Point and Shoot (PS) camera for a while, and this is not the one. The day I started using it, it already gave me a lot of trouble. My level of skill is average; I know the basics. I know enough to realize I need to return this camera. This review is not meant to offend any who might like this camera, but simply to give other potential customers an insight on my experience with this camera. Hope it helps :)PROS:- small- fast charging- sleek and thinCONS:- horrible lighting, despite tinkering with lighting and ISO- grainy/noisy pics- large battery- battery charger requires additional cord- bulky camera case- flimsy cover on SD/battery slot- instructions do not come all in english; comes in 22 languages, so it's all mixed together and hard to readcheap price, but not worth it

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution
3x optical zoom; 2.7-inch widescreen LCD
State-of-the-art Exilim Engine 4.0; Dynamic Photo function
HD Movie function
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Casio Exilim EX-S12 12MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
